What is a Digital Wallet?
There is no lack of digital wallets in Hong Kong. Each of them is characterized by its own feature. Some such as PayMe provide P2P payment functions allowing users to make fund transfers while others such as Alipay HK and WeChat Pay HK provide additional functions like cross-border payment and bill payment, etc. Depending on your spending habits, some digital wallets may suit you better than others. MoneySmart has put together some information about digital wallets for you to understand their operations and the latest offers:
Which is the best Digital Wallets in Hong Kong?
There are 8 commonly used digital wallets in Hong Kong including PayMe, AlipayHK, WeChat Pay HK, BoC Pay, O! ePay, Tap&Go, UnionPay and TNG Wallet, each of them has its own unique benefits and functions:
PayMe
PayMe users don’t have to be an HSBC customer. Anyone with a Hong Kong selected bank account or a credit card can use PayMe to split the bills with friends easily in just a few taps with a mobile number no matter what local bank they are with. You can easily top up your PayMe account with a registered credit card or a bank account. What’s more, you can now pay participating merchants via PayMe in stores with the PayMe logo.
AlipayHK
AlipayHK is best for TaoBao and TMall frequent shoppers. Simply select Alipay HK in the payment method at the checkout to enjoy handling fee waiver. Besides, Alipay is a multi-functional mobile payment app, providing users with bill payment and cross-border payment service in over one million participating businesses across mainland China and Japan with a good exchange. What’s more, users can enjoy scanning ‘Quick Reward Code’ to get offers when travelling. Users can now top up through local stores, Standard Chartered Online Banking or coin carts.
WeChat Pay HK
WeChat Pay HK is the first mobile payment app allowing users to settle bills on the mainland with the Hong Kong dollar. Participating vendors include Didi Chuxing, Meituan-Dianping and railway ticketing platform 12306.cn. Purchases will be converted from RMB to HKD automatically on the app, where exchange rate quotes and automatic exchange services are available. Users can now top up through local stores, bank accounts or credit cards.
BoC Pay
BoC Pay is a multifunctional cross-border payment mobile application which enables P2P transfer function, QR code payment, bill payment and mobile payment function in the Greater Bay Area without a bank account on the mainland. Users don’t have to be BoC customers to use BoC Pay. As long as you are 18 years old with Hong Kong residency and a valid mobile number plus an email address, you can apply. First-time users can enjoy HK$20 welcome rewards on or before 30 June 2020.
O! ePay
Octopus O! ePay is a multifunctional mobile payment app. Users can top up Octopus cards, make online purchases, and transfer funds within the apps. With O! ePay, users can manage up to 20 Octopus Cards. Users can also shop online with O! ePay Mastercard, which is a reloadable virtual Platinum prepaid card allowing users to shop globally at online merchants taking Mastercard. Users can top up an O! ePay account through Octopus card, local stores and fund transfers from Standard Chartered bank/credit card. Users can transfer funds between O!ePay and bank accounts.
Tap & Go
Tap & Go is Hong Kong's first prepaid mobile wallet incorporating both Mastercard® and UnionPay card schemes to provide payments online and at physical stores around the globe. Anyone who is 11 years old or above with Hong Kong, Macau or Mainland China mobile number can activate Tap & Go.
UnionPay
UnionPay mobile application is a one-stop mobile payment service. Users can enjoy mobile payment services in 48 countries and regions. Moreover, users can also pay simply by scanning UnionPay QR code In China alone, UnionPay QR code payment is widely accepted at over 16 million merchants.
TNG Wallet
TNG Wallet is a one-stop mobile payment app. It does not only provide person-to-person money transfer, merchant payment service but also enables users to handle foreign currency. Users can easily exchange foreign currencies and transfer money from TNG Wallet to designated countries such as the UK, Singapore and Hong Kong. Users can top up at 7-Eleven or Circle K or use a credit card or the online banking platform of participating banks such as Bank of China to top up.
Benefit of linking credit cards to digital wallets
Cardholders can connect your credit cards to digital wallets like PayMe, WeChat Pay and Alipay HK to earn extra rewards, air miles and cash rebate:
Earn Air Miles
Top up PayMe, Alipay and WeChat Pay HK with Citi Prestige Card, Citi PremierMiles Card, Standard Chartered Asia Miles Mastercard and DBS Black World MasterCard to get miles. Please be aware that the monthly PayMe top-up limit is HK$5,000 and each credit card caps the amount of miles cardholder can earn as listed above.
Earn Cashback
Top up PayMe e-wallet with Standard Chartered Simply Cash Visa Card and Citibank cards to enjoy cash rebate. Please be aware that the monthly PayMe top-up limit is HK$5,000 and each credit card caps the amount of cashback cardholder can earn as listed above.
Enjoy welcome offers at no cost
Most banks except Citibank exclude digital wallet as eligible transactions for welcome offers. New customers applying for Citibank cards can enjoy welcome gifts with no costs simply by topping up digital wallets with below amount, and transfer the money back to the bank account:

How PayMe works & How to use it?
PayMe is a 'Digital Wallet', designed to easily pay back your friends and family and also get paid to a Hong Kong local bank account through the apps for free. You need to top up your PayMe account with a credit card or bank account to pay and you need to have a local bank account to get paid. To be eligible to use PayMe, you need to be at least 18 years old and hold a valid HKID and Visa/MasterCard.

Digital Wallet FAQ
How can I enjoy digital wallet offers?
Users can earn offers with digital wallets when spending at designated merchants. The rebate, in general, will be added to your account automatically within the apps. Some digital wallets will provide time-limited welcome offers as well such as AlipayHK and BoC Pay.
Can I use WeChat Pay or Alipay in China?
Yes, you can. Both WeChat Pay and Alipay provide cross-border payment services, which allow users to pay purchases made in China with HKD.
Can I transfer money overseas with digital wallets?
Yes. With a specific digital wallet such as TNG wallet, you can transfer money to specific countries such as Singapore, Canada and the UK.
How to earn rebates with digital wallets?
Users can earn rebates with an eligible credit card. Simply top up your digital wallets such as PayMe with an eligible credit card, then transfer the top-up amount to your bank account. In this way, you can earn rebates at no cost. It’s slightly different for Alipay HK and WeChat Pay. It’s less direct. You have to bind your credit card and transfer funds to a friend of yours first. If he/she does the same, transferring the same amount of funds to you through the digital wallets, then it will cancel out the amount of money that you send to him or her. In this way, you can earn rebates without costing you anything.
How can I know if my cards can earn rebates in digital wallets?
There is a wide range of credit cards providing rebates for digital wallets but credit card providers can change the terms and conditions at any point so you can also refer to MoneySmart website for the latest information. Depending on whether you would like to earn rebates or collect miles, you can consider using these credit cards with the highest top-up rebate including Citi Cash Back Card, Citi Prestige Card, Dah Sing British Airways Platinum Card and CCB Eye Card.
Which Digital Wallet is the best?
There is no such thing as the best digital wallet, it all depends on your spending habits and which credit card you own. For example, if you are a frequent traveller to China, Alipay or Wechat Pay offers transaction functions in China with multiple merchant offers and promotions, which will give you more benefits than other digital wallets.
Can I earn rebates with all of the digital wallets?
You can earn air miles or cash rebates by linking credit cards to most of the digital wallets, including Alipay, WeChat Pay, PayMe etc. However, not all digital wallets offer credit card rewards, take TNG wallet as an example, top-up with a credit card will cost you 2.5% of the total top-up amount as an administration fee, with no rebate rewards.
What is the difference between PayMe and FPS?
PayMe e-wallet is an app launched by HSBC with a daily transfer limit of HK$5,000. It supports instant interbank fund transfer but it takes 2-3 days for transferring the balance of PayMe to HSBC/Hang Seng bank account. FPS is an interbank fund transfer system launched by the HKMA, which is directly linked to a bank account. The daily transfer limit is HK$10,000. It also supports instant interbank fund transfer. Registration through the bank required.
